body: Gerald Gutierrez, who won two consecutive Tony awards in 1995 and 1996 as best director for ''The Heiress'' and ''A Delicate Balance'' respectively, died suddenly at his home in Brooklyn. He was 53. The time of his death has not been determined. The cause was apparently respiratory failure as a result of the flu, said his brother, Nicholas, who
title: Gerald Gutierrez, Director, Is Dead at 53

body: Kids stealing bikes. Immigrants mugged on payday. A U.P.S. man was threatened and now makes deliveries with an armed guard. As isolated cases, many crimes reported in Victorian Flatbush over the last six months wouldn't have merited a headline in the local paper. But when reported through an e-mail newsletter to more than 500 households, the crimes
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: FLATBUSH; Rates Go Up, Rates Go Down, But Crime Is Always Personal

body: Yuri Foreman didn't have any Hanukkah plans. Not this year, when Foreman, an unbeaten junior middleweight, has had trouble getting a fight that doesn't fall through or winning a purse with enough money to actually spend. For the past three months, Foreman, who was born in Belarus, immigrated to Israel and learned to box with Israeli Arabs, has been
title: BOXING; Jewish Boxers Are Looking to Make a Comeback

body: Five months after Chancellor Joel I. Klein admitted that the New York City schools were wrongly pushing out many struggling high school students, the Department of Education says it has turned around its handling of students who have fallen behind and are not expected to graduate on time. ''Discharges are absolutely down for the period ending Dec.
title: Schools Reduce the Number of Students They Force to Leave Early

body: A Ukrainian immigrant who supported his wife and grandson by ferrying pizzas around his Brooklyn neighborhood was shot in a robbery after dropping off an order on Sunday, and died the next morning, the police said. The Domino's delivery man, speaking in broken English, was able to give only a vague description of his attacker before he died. The
title: Brooklyn Man Is Fatally Shot While Delivering Pizzas

body: Sparked by the two-way star Diego Oquendo, Tottenville sneaked past Canarsie, 28-24, yesterday in front of 2,000 fans to win the Public Schools Athletic League football title at Midwood High School in Brooklyn. It was Tottenville's second P.S.A.L. football title. The Pirates also won in 1997. Tottenville's title marked the seventh championship for
title: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL; Two-Way Starter Leads Tottenville to the Title

body: When Tottenville High School (12-0) of Staten Island and Canarsie (11-0) of Brooklyn square off at noon today to decide the Public Schools Athletic League championship, a run-oriented, high-scoring physical game figures to unfold at Midwood Field in Brooklyn. ''Our game revolves around us running the ball,'' Tottenville Coach Jim Munson said.
title: SPORTS BRIEFING: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL; Public League Title Game

body: DEAR DIARY: A young violinist I know was invited to audition for a quartet in New York. A cheap flight was arranged for her, arriving and departing from Islip. After the audition, she missed her 8 p.m. flight and found herself stranded until the next plane out, at 6 a.m. She read for a couple of hours, then called her boyfriend (also a violinist)
title: Metropolitan Diary

body: LIKE a lot of residents of a little corner of Flatbush, Brooklyn, known as Ditmas Park and Ditmas Park West, Katleen Felix Ranger and her husband, Pascal, a cosmetics executive, started their housing search in fashionable Park Slope. But after they had looked at a few small, expensive and somewhat noisy brownstone condominium units near Seventh
title: If You're Thinking of Living In/Ditmas Park and Ditmas Park West; Spirited Enclaves With Grand Homes

body: KRAMER--Julius, age 91, passed away on October 5, 2003. Husband of the late Ruth Markowitz Kramer and dear friend of the late Hilda Castellon. Father of the late David Kramer. Survived by daughter Elizabeth Anderson, brother Herbert & sisters-in-law Phyllis Roth & Adele Leight. Dedicated retired social studies teacher & grade advisor at Midwood
title: Paid Notice: Deaths KRAMER, JULIUS

author: Shaila K. Dewan is a reporter for the Metro Section of The Times.
body: Even on a Friday night in summer, Coney Island snaps shut like a clamshell when it rains. The stalls selling frozen daiquiris in tall plastic beakers are shuttered, and the old-timers disappear from Ruby's boardwalk bar. But walk past Astroland, and you'll find one place lighted up with carny promise, where paintings of a bearded lady and a
title: THE WAY WE LIVE NOW: 10-5-03: PHENOMENON; (Not) For His Eyes Only

body: Two high school students were wounded yesterday in stabbings at separate schools and were hospitalized. In Flushing, Queens, an 18-year-old student at John Bowne High School was slashed across the left ear and face after a dispute over a girl, said Margie Feinberg, a spokeswoman for the Department of Education. The victim, whose name was not
title: Metro Briefing | New York: 2 Students At 2 Schools Are Stabbed

body: A rabbi walked out of his home in Midwood yesterday to find two bottles that appeared to contain flammable liquid next to his front door and a singe mark under a window, the police said. The incident, on the second day of Rosh Hashana, occurred on East 8th Street at 4 p.m. and led to a broad police response, with detectives and arson investigators
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Police Called To Rabbi's Home

body: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg made a campaign-style swing through Brooklyn last month. Problem was, it was the day of the blackout, so his visit was cut short and all but ignored by the news media. Undeterred, Mr. Bloomberg scheduled Brooklyn Day, Part 2. So as the cameras rolled yesterday, the mayor trekked across the borough for the second time in
title: In Brooklyn, Mayor Attends To Some Unfinished Business

body: Some parishioners at churches around the city have started attending services with pockets full of quarters. They are not for the collection tray, but for feeding one-hour parking meters, 19,500 of which were put into service on Sundays between late last year and early this year. Some churches and elected officials have criticized the change,
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: NEW YORK UP CLOSE; Churchgoers Want Meters to Honor the Sabbath, Too

body: By most measures, Midwood High School is a shining example of a successful urban school: it has one of the highest graduation rates in the city, a yearly crop of Intel science award semifinalists, and a college night so packed with recruiters that booths fill both gymnasiums and the cafeteria. Earlier this year, it was listed as one of the city
title: Define Paradox? A Leading School, Below Standard

body: SOME of the residents of Avenue I sat on front stoops Thursday night, chatting in the glow of flashlights about the blackout that had enveloped their corner of Brooklyn. But even in this precious moment of conviviality, Janelle Barabash could not help herself; she had to say it. You know, she said. The parrots didn't do this. Every neighborhood has
title: About New York; Bright Birds, Dark City? Not This Time

body: NATALIA LULOVA could be like other 12-year-olds. She could be practicing how to swim, how to jump rope, how to spit through gaps in her teeth. Instead, she diligently practices the paranormal exercise of ''seeing'' with her eyes blindfolded, so that one day she might open them to find a check for one million eye-popping dollars. She is a pupil of
title: About New York; When Seeing Is Believing. Or Is It?

body: Those who knew Esther Segal said she would not have wanted all this. Television news cameras filmed her funeral yesterday morning, and hundreds of mourners thronged the streets of Borough Park, Brooklyn, crying because she died and lauding her life. Friends and family members said all of the attention would have been too much for Mrs. Segal, 52,
title: Killed by Storm-Shattered Tree Limb, Woman Is Mourned

body: A series of thunderstorms erupted over New York and New Jersey yesterday, resulting in the death of a Brooklyn woman who was hit by a falling tree limb and and knocking out power to thousands of residents in the region. The police reported that a tornado briefly touched down in Somerset County, N.J., and a volatile mix of lightning, hail and heavy
title: Brooklyn Woman Is Killed as Storms Batter the Region

body: To the Editor: The article ''Bustling Area With a Touch of Country'' [If You're Thinking of Living in Midwood, June 29] brought a touch of nostalgia to this 80-year-old. As a child, I lived at Avenue H and East 18th Street. From 1937 to 1941, I commuted to Brooklyn Technical High School on the Brighton line using that H Avenue station described in
title: Recalling Midwood And Brighton Line

body: WITH their deep front porches and overhanging eaves, Midwood's predominantly shingled two-story houses with front yards and driveways feel more like suburbia than like Brooklyn. Developed at the turn of the century as an alternative to Manhattan congestion, Midwood lies directly south of Flatbush and offers a fast link on Ocean Parkway to the
title: If You're Thinking of Living In/Midwood; Bustling Area With a Touch of Country

body: The brothers Atanasov -- Dimitre, Vladimir and Alex -- grumble about their after-school lessons like typical American boys; in their case, boys who are being forced to take up to five hours a week of ballroom-style dance lessons. ''I'm there 24/7,'' said Dimitre, who will not even tell his friends at Dyker Heights Intermediate School that he spends
title: The Russians Are Coming, Stepping Lightly

body: Midwood High School Coach Artie Leitner thought this would be a rebuilding year because his softball team had lost five starters to graduation. Almost one month into the season, pitcher Dawn Duggan thought the Hornets would have difficulty advancing past the quarterfinals in the Public Schools Athletic League playoffs. Yesterday, they became New
title: PLUS: SOFTBALL; Midwood Takes City Championship

body: The signs in Midwood, Brooklyn, surfaced slowly at first. Curry packets at the New Apna Bazaar started to accumulate. The line of cars at the Sunoco station began to thin. And then the crowd dwindled at Friday Prayer at the Makki Mosque on Coney Island Avenue. This, among worshipers once so numerous they prayed on the street for lack of room. ''Now
title: In Brooklyn, 9/11 Damage Continues

But for intrepid travelers yearning to stand before the luxury apartments in the building where Walt Whitman once toiled, or to
title: New Tour Pays Homage to Poetry and Cheesecake

body: Anthony DePalma's victory yesterday in the final event, the javelin, clinched the team title for Msgr. Farrell of Staten Island in the Catholic High School Athletic Association New York boys' sectionals at Mount St. Michael Field in the Bronx. Farrell had 75 points, with Mount St. Michael second at 66. Mount St. Michael posted the meet's one
title: PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD; MSGR. FARRELL HIGH WINS SECTIONALS

title: Paid Notice: Deaths ROHN, ARYEH

body: ''I WANT a pastrami on rye, fatty, not too lean,'' said the middle-age man in line at Katz's, on the Lower East Side, practically wagging his finger at the counterman. ''Pastrami shouldn't be lean. And I want coleslaw on the sandwich, but put it on the side, because I got to drive my truck to Jersey and I don't want it to get soggy. Put the mustard
title: Putting An Ageless Pleasure Between The Rye

body: Northport High School's boys' distance medley, which posted a nation-leading time of 10 minutes 15.23 seconds six weeks ago, won its outdoor debut yesterday at the Mountie Relays at McGovern Relay in the Bronx. Bad weather - rain, wind and temperatures under 40 degrees - led to a slow winning time, 10:48.73. New Rochelle dominated the girls' events
title: PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD; Northport Wins Distance Medley

body: In summer, the front porch beckoned, its overhang providing shade for idlers. In winter, travelers crowded around the potbellied stove inside, warming their hands at its cast iron sides as the chimney sent a smoky trail into the sky. A country inn this is not. It is the 97-year-old wooden subway station at Avenue H on the Q line in Midwood,
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: MIDWOOD; A Community's Future May Rest on a Station's Past

body: The other day, as war loomed and New Yorkers worried that their city could be a prime target, Mark Mandelshtam, 74 years old, sat in an apartment in Midwood, Brooklyn, fingering a small engraved medal. ''900 Days, 900 Nights'' it read in Cyrillic letters -- the amount of time his native city, Leningrad, was under siege by an unseen enemy during
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: BROOKLYN UP CLOSE; Leningrad's 900-Day Siege Lives Vividly to Its Children

body: They are almost a representative sample of the people who give life to the city's smallest transactions: the Indian immigrant in the Yankees cap who worked 12 hours a day at his Around the Clock Minimart. The shy Russian bachelor who loved science fiction and made change in the all-night coin laundry. The guy whose vast Italian-Brooklyn-American
title: The Only Motive Seems to Be Murder; 4 Quiet Lives Ended, Apparently by a Serial Killer

body: A man in a hooded sweatshirt shot and killed a worker in a Brooklyn coin laundry yesterday for no apparent reason, and detectives have linked the slaying to three other unprovoked killings at businesses in Brooklyn and Queens in the past month, a police official said. Ballistic evidence connects the weapon used to kill the worker, Albert Kotlyar,
title: Slaying at Brooklyn Laundry Is Linked to 3 Other Killings

body: For José Ramírez, the world has hardly been a bed of roses. In fact, for a while in his young life he had no bed at all to call his own, so poor was his family in Brownsville, Brooklyn. My Thanh Nguyen's earliest memories are of her family's escape from Vietnam by boat, an overcrowded vessel that ripped apart in a storm, with My Thanh clinging to
title: 20 Triumphant Spirits Earn Times Scholarships

body: On Oct. 27, 2002, Sammi Hadzovic and his sister went shopping at the Costco in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, and bought a 24-bottle flat of Tropicana Season's Best Ruby Red Grapefruit Juice. At home, Mr. Hadzovic's sister started handing out the 10-ounce bottles to her three children. As she shook one bottle, she felt something solid moving inside it. She
title: Looking At a Bottle Of Juice That Looks Back

body: The people at Maimonides Medical Center in Brooklyn are justifiably proud of their accomplishments. Maimonides performed the first heart transplant in the United States, in 1967, and its award-winning computer systems allow several doctors at remote sites to view an X-ray simultaneously. But in its ongoing efforts to serve the dizzyingly diverse
title: With Hospital Bed, You Get Eggroll, and It's Kosher

body: Vandals spray-painted swastikas on eight cars in the Midwood section of Brooklyn, the police said yesterday. It was the second incident of racist vandalism in Brooklyn in less than two weeks. The cars were discovered around 6 a.m. yesterday in an area around 29th Street and Avenue L. On Jan. 16 vandals defaced 26 cars on a two-block stretch of
title: Swastikas Painted on Cars

body: THE weather this week had Shelly Kalmanson seriously second-guessing his career choice. Mr. Kalmanson delivers the mail to 600 boxes a day in Breezy Point, the westernmost tip of the Rockaways, the peninsula in southern Queens that dangles into the Atlantic like a pinkie testing the waters. When a reporter called the United States Postal Service
title: PUBLIC LIVES; Not a Good Day to Be the Mailman

body: A man who dressed as an Orthodox Jew and burglarized nine synagogues in Sheepshead Bay and Midwood in recent weeks has been arrested, the authorities said yesterday. From Dec. 28 until about Saturday, the man, Mark Cukierwar, 31, dressed in yarmulke and black suit, broke into the synagogues after hours and stole money from the collection boxes,
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Arrest In Synagogue Burglaries

body: BRODSKY-Leonard. Passed away January 5, 2003 at age 76, after a short illness. A commanding presence, Lenny touched many lives with his intelligence, compassion, and humor. He will remain a strong and positive influence to those who knew and loved him. Loving husband of Blossom (nee Kornbluh Frankel), and his beloved, the late Sunny (nee
title: Paid Notice: Deaths BRODSKY, LEONARD

body: HILLSON-Mildred. 91, December 30, 2002 in West Caldwell NJ. Survived by Henry, her husband of 67 years, children Louise Werlin and Jean Ellis and grandchildren Jonathan, Rachel and Rebecca.
